Package javagameengine.components

Class Component

    • javagameengine.components.Component

extends java.lang.Object

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addChild​(Component c)
      This function adds a child to the parent it could be any javagameengine component GameObject, Physics-body and so on
      void destroy()
      This method will destroy this object it will remove it from the component handler
      void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This is where the component will be drawn (rendered)
      void drawChildren​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws all components children If this is not called in compnets children will not be drawn.
      <T extends Component>
      Component      		 getChild​(T t)
      This method will return the first child in the children with the same type as the argument example GameObject a = this.getChild(new GameObject());

      • getPosition

        public Vector2 getPosition()
        This is the global position everything counts on this. it is from the left top cornde of the sprite
        Returns:
        current position

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition​(Vector2 position)
        This will only be set if the component isnt a child. This is because if the component is a child it will set its positon to its parent + its local piston
        Parameters:
        position - vector2 positon

      • getSpritePosition

        public Vector2 getSpritePosition()
        This has its origo in the middle of the object. It is also affected by the camera position.

      • getSpriteScale

        public Vector2 getSpriteScale()

      • getLocalPosition

        public Vector2 getLocalPosition()

      • setLocalPosition

        public void setLocalPosition​(Vector2 localPosition)
        The localpositon is used for offseting the child from the parent. If parent has pos 1,1 and we want the child to have 1,2 our localpositon should be set 0,1 because it is a offset.
        Parameters:
        localPosition - vector2

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if the component is enabled and returns parent isEnabled if it is a child

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled​(boolean enabled)
        If enabled is false the component will not bwe updated and not bw drawn.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to be updated and drawn

      • addChild

        public void addChild​(Component c)
        This function adds a child to the parent it could be any javagameengine component GameObject, Physics-body and so on
        Parameters:
        c - the child you want to add

      • getChild

        public <T extends Component> Component getChild​(T t)
        This method will return the first child in the children with the same type as the argument example GameObject a = this.getChild(new GameObject());
        Type Parameters:
        T - idk
        Parameters:
        t - the class of the child to be retured
        Returns:
        the first child that is of type T

      • getChildren

        public <T extends Component> java.util.LinkedList<T> getChildren​(T t)
        This method will return the all children in the children with the same type as the argument example a = this.getChild(new GameObject());
        Type Parameters:
        T - idk
        Parameters:
        t - Type of children to return
        Returns:
        list of children of type T

      • getChildren

        public java.util.LinkedList<Component> getChildren()
        This method will return the all children in the children with the same type as the argument example a = this.getChild(new GameObject());
        Returns:
        list of all children

        public void removeChild​(Component child)

      • instantiate

        public void instantiate​(Component c)
        This method will add the component to the component handler this means that you have created a new parent
        Parameters:
        c - the object to instantiate

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        This method will destroy this object it will remove it from the component handler

      • update

        public void update()
        this is the update function. It will be called on every game update it updates all the children.

      • updateChildren

        public void updateChildren()
        Updates all the children

      • drawChildren

        public void drawChildren​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws all components children If this is not called in compnets children will not be drawn. If you dont use super in the draw you have to call this fucntion so the children gets drawn
        Parameters:
        g - the Grapcis object you get from the draw function

      • draw

        public void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This is where the component will be drawn (rendered)
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics that can be used for draing
